summary: This document consists of internal communications regarding AML compliance alerts related to prospective client Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the clearance of alerts based on reputational concerns and the approval process for onboarding Epstein as a client. The document highlights the distinction between two individuals with similar names and the compliance team's decision to proceed with Epstein's account opening.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the main subject of the compliance alerts being discussed, with concerns raised about his reputation.

persons.name: Chip Packard
persons.context: Chip Packard provided approval from a legal perspective to onboard Jeffrey Epstein despite the alerts.

persons.name: Andrew J. Kisz
persons.context: Andrew Kisz is the AML Compliance Officer who reviewed the alerts and communicated the clearance decision.

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.context: Amanda Kirby is involved in the communication regarding the clearance of the alerts and the onboarding process for Epstein.

connections.description: Chip Packard approved the onboarding of Jeffrey Epstein as a client despite the alerts raised.
Andrew Kisz, as the compliance officer, reviewed the alerts related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Amanda Kirby is an associate handling the onboarding process for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: RDC and PCR Alerts Review
events.description: AML Compliance reviewed alerts pertaining to Jeffrey Epstein, determining some were false positives.

events.title: Client Onboarding Approval
events.description: Approval was sought to move forward with opening accounts for Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The document discusses AML compliance alerts related to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a review of his reputation.
Two individuals with similar names were distinguished, with alerts pertaining to Jeffrey S. Epstein being cleared as false positives.
Chip Packard's approval was crucial for proceeding with Epstein as a client despite the alerts.
The document emphasizes the importance of compliance clearance before onboarding clients with reputational concerns.
